channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light obscured by vegetation, 13th November
item.description:
Street light is working but almost completely obscured by vegetation growth. Please could you trim this back?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 406 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges at 65 Pitman Road covering the footpath. Cowbridge, 13th November
item.description:
Somebody needs to get in touch with Cheltenham Borough homes, the resident at 65 Pitman Road is obviously having trouble looking after the garden. The hedges around the property also need trimming now because they are covering the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 63 Pitman Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several Potholes near blind corner, 11th November
item.description:
The location is the bottom of Aggs Hill just past the farm entrance and where the road starts to climb. Just after the potholes is a blind corner and the presence of the holes means vehicles are moving to the centre in both directions which has produced a momnet or two! Please can these be filled in on both sides of the road and up to the corner so the whole road width can be used in both directions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waterlogged footpath - upgrade with handstanding, 10th November
item.description:
Footpath off junction where Churchill Road meets Mead Road will be walking route from Naunton Park Primary to High School Leckhampton from Sept 2022. Route here: https://www.relive.cc/view/vwq1k8gpVLO Consider upgrading with hardstanding to improve all weather use.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 60 Mead Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Miserden Road hedge very overgrown., 10th November
item.description:
Residents regularly clear the leaves from the road to prevent flooding, but this is currently difficult due to the hedge and undergrowth growing out into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Miserden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lotts Meadow footpath to new High School Leckhampton, 10th November
item.description:
Could an all weather cycle/footpath be added to Lotts Meadow to assist children walking across it to new High School Leckhampton in advance of September 2022 opening of school please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Bungalow Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Naunton Park Primary access safety improvements, 10th November
item.description:
Wondered if there was some scope to add some warning lines & perhaps a Leckhampton Road crossing point (zig zags/island) to improve safety at this access route to Naunton Park Primary

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 49 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive Mud on Road, 10th November
item.description:
Mud from junction development tracking from site a long way along Innsworth Lane. Going to be dangerous with further rain or overnight frosts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Innsworth Lane, Longlevens

item.title: Drain covers sank causing lorrys to make loud bangs when driven over it, 9th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 108 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
